etymologies: modern Latin, perhaps from medieval Latin qualea ‘quail’

definitions: a brownish weaverbird found in Africa, the male of which has either a black face or a red head.

notes.text: Genus Quelea, family Ploceidae: three species, in particular the red-billed quelea (Q. quelea), which occurs in huge numbers and is an important pest of crops

shortDefinitions: brownish weaver bird found in Africa, male
